message.content:
cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.SI 

The paper proposes a statistical learning model for classifying cognitive processes based on distributed patterns of neural activation in the brain, acquired via functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI). The proposed method involves forming local meshes around each voxel and using functional connectivity matrices to estimate the relationship between voxels within a mesh. The resulting Functional Connectivity aware Local Relational Features (FC-LRF) are then used to train a statistical learning machine. This paper involves machine learning, neural networks, and image processing, which are all sub-categories of computer science. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
